choice_explanation: $5,000 represents 2+ years income for low-wage Lima workers. Economic coercion is primary recruitment driver - 70-80% of couriers are women, mostly single mothers.
tooltip_info: International drug trafficking: 3-9 years in Spain, 6-15 years in Peru. No legal distinction for economic coercion.

choice_explanation: Refusing doesn't guarantee safety. Traffickers use debt bondage and threats. Witness protection is severely underfunded in Peru.
tooltip_info: Debt bondage is trafficking under Peru Law 28950, but enforcement is weak. Police corruption documented.

tooltip_info: If packets rupture: medical emergency, possible death. Hospital arrest is mandatory under Spanish law.

tooltip_info: Detection is highly probable. Conviction rate >95%. Spain: 3-9 years, no mule defense.

choice_text: Back out at the last moment
choice_explanation: Backing out creates 'debt' from wasted expenses. Trafficking organizations use violence and coercion to force compliance.
tooltip_info: Organizations retaliate against refusals. Debt bondage and threats are common. Limited police protection.

choice_text: Tell flight crew you need help
choice_explanation: Emergency medical intervention can save your life but means certain arrest. Spanish hospitals must report suspected couriers.
tooltip_info: Medical treatment is mandatory. Arrest in hospital. Spain: 3-9 years for 500g trafficking.

choice_text: Stay quiet and hope to survive
choice_explanation: If you survive, you get paid. But the first trip traps you - organizations force repeat trips through threats and debt.
tooltip_info: Successful couriers are coerced into multiple trips. Average: 10+ runs before arrest. No real exit.

choice_explanation: Witness protection exists in law but is underfunded. Protection typically reserved for high-level cases, not recruitment attempts.
tooltip_info: Peru Law 27378 protection rarely available for low-level cases. Police corruption in drug cases documented.

tooltip_info: Debt bondage is trafficking but rarely prosecuted. Economic desperation drives eventual participation.
